about.title: Our Story
about.tagline: Where Cambridge's pub heritage meets Himalayan hospitality
description: Built in the 1930s on the site of the old Butchers Arms, The Corner House is an Art Deco landmark on Newmarket Road ‚Äî a true neighbourhood pub at the heart of Abbey for nearly a century.

In 2024, we entered an exciting new chapter under Lapen Inns, introducing an authentic Nepalese kitchen while preserving everything locals love: real ales, crackling fireplaces, quiz nights, and that unmistakable pub warmth.
The result is something uniquely Cambridge ‚Äî hand-pinched momo and Himalayan curries served alongside proper pints and pub classics.
features: 1930s Art Deco heritage with original fireplaces and timber snugs
Authentic Nepalese kitchen led by Kathmandu-born chefs
Wall-to-wall HD screens plus outdoor projector for big matches
Heated private cabins bookable year-round in the beer garden
CAMRA 'Most Improved City Pub' 2020 award winner

image.alt: The Corner House ‚Äî Art Deco pub on Newmarket Road, Cambridge since the 1930s

signatureDishes.title: Signature Nepalese Dishes
signatureDishes.subtitle: Authentic Himalayan flavours crafted by our Kathmandu-born chefs

items.name: Chicken Rum Rum
items.description: Our signature curry ‚Äî tender chicken simmered in rich tomato, ginger, and timmur pepper sauce with distinctive citrus-spice warmth.

items.name: Himali Lamb
items.description: Slow-braised lamb shoulder in aromatic Himalayan spices with a velvety, cardamom-infused sauce. Fall-off-the-bone tender.

items.name: Khasi Ko Masu
items.description: Traditional Nepali goat curry ‚Äî bone-in meat slow-cooked with whole spices until meltingly tender. A heritage recipe.

items.name: House Mixed Grill
items.description: A sizzling feast of tandoori chicken, seekh kebab, lamb chops, and king prawns ‚Äî marinated 24 hours and grilled to perfection.

items.name: Steamed Momo
items.description: Hand-pleated Nepali dumplings with spiced chicken or vegetables, served with signature tomato-sesame achar. Made fresh daily.

items.name: Samosa Chaat
items.description: Crispy samosas crumbled over tangy chickpea curry, topped with yoghurt, tamarind chutney, and crunchy sev. Nepali street food.

reviews.title: Loved by Locals & Visitors Alike
reviews.subtitle: From first-time visitors to devoted regulars, our guests share what makes The Corner House a Cambridge favourite.

items.quote: Superb Himali Lamb Curry and friendly staff who helped us navigate the Nepalese dishes. We'll definitely be back!
Perfect spot for a Cambridge reunion ‚Äî attentive team, great drinks, brilliant atmosphere. The heated cabins are a game-changer.
Old pub with a twist. Nepalese curry was excellent and plenty of HD screens for the match. Best of both worlds!
The momo are the best I've had outside Nepal. Authentic taste, generous portions, and the staff genuinely care.
Second time here ‚Äî same delicious curry and very reasonable prices for Cambridge. Now our go-to Friday night spot.
Family-friendly pub with incredible food. Staff handled our kids' dietary requests perfectly.
Came for the pre-match atmosphere, stayed for the Chicken Rum Rum. This pub has soul!

pressFeature.quote: Keeping the local alive with pints, momo, and matchday buzz on Newmarket Road.

openGraph.title: About {{brand.shortName}} ‚Äì Pints, momo, and Matchday Energy
openGraph.description: How a historic Cambridge pub became the city‚Äôs go-to sports pub with a full Nepalese kitchen and cosy snugs.

hero.title: About {{brand.shortName}}
hero.subtitle: Cambridge‚Äôs go-to sports pub with Nepalese plates and cosy snugs on Newmarket Road.

story.title: Our Story
story.introduction: Built in the 1930s as a corner pub, {{brand.shortName}} now pairs authentic Nepalese cooking with a lively sports bar atmosphere. After earning CAMRA‚Äôs Most Improved City Pub award in 2020, the pub entered a new chapter in late 2024 under Lapen Inns, installing a Nepalese kitchen while keeping real ale, HD screens, and the community spirit alive.

timeline.title: Nepalese kitchen & sports hub relaunch

hero.title: Our Menu: Authentic Nepalese Cuisine & British Pub Classics
hero.subtitle: Discover authentic Himalayan flavours prepared with traditional recipes alongside your favourite pub classics. From Bhutuwa chicken and Pokhareli fish curry to British favourites and well-kept cask ales.

sections.description: Experience authentic Nepalese cuisine prepared by talented chefs Ravi Acharya and Purna Man Bajrachaya, alongside traditional British pub favourites.
sections.allergenNotice: Please inform us of any allergies or dietary requirements when ordering.

privacy.introduction: We respect your privacy and handle personal information responsibly in line with applicable UK data protection laws (UK GDPR & Data Protection Act 2018). This policy explains what we collect, why we collect it, how it is used, and the rights available to you when you interact with {{brand.fullName}}.

whoWeAre.title: Who We Are
whoWeAre.content: **{{brand.fullName}}** ‚Äì a 1930s art-deco pub with a Nepalese kitchen and sports lounge at 231 Newmarket Road, Cambridge, CB5 8JE. References to "we" / "us" / "our" mean {{brand.fullName}}.

dataWeCollect.title: Data We Collect
items: Contact details: name, email, phone (when you enquire or book)
Booking preferences: date, time, party size, special notes (e.g. dietary requirements)
Event/private hire details: occasion type, approximate numbers, requested facilities
Voluntary feedback: reviews, messages, survey responses
Technical data: IP address, device/browser type, pages viewed (via analytics / logs) via Plausible (privacy-friendly, no cookies for core metrics)

howWeUse.title: How We Use Personal Data
items: Respond to questions & provide customer support
Send optional updates / newsletters (only with explicit consent)
Comply with legal obligations (e.g. safety or regulatory queries)

items.description: running and improving our business & site
marketing communications (you can withdraw any time)

sharingDisclosure.title: Sharing & Disclosure
sharingDisclosure.content: We do not sell your data. Limited sharing occurs with trusted service providers strictly for operational purposes (e.g. booking / hosting platform, email service) under appropriate safeguards. We may disclose data if required by law or to protect our legal rights.

dataRetention.title: Data Retention
dataRetention.content: We retain data only as long as needed for the purposes stated or to meet legal/accounting requirements. Generic enquiry emails are typically retained for **12 months**. Booking records (for accounting / safety) may be stored up to 7 years per UK HMRC guidance. You may request deletion (see Your Rights) unless we must retain for legitimate reasons.

security.title: Security
security.content: We apply reasonable technical and organisational measures (access controls, least-privilege, encrypted transport). No system is 100% secure; please contact us if you suspect misuse.

cookies.title: Cookies & Similar Technologies
cookies.content: We use essential cookies for core site functionality and may use minimal analytics. Plausible analytics runs without tracking or storing personal data and does not use identifying cookies. If we introduce any optional marketing or performance cookies, a consent banner will list them before activation.

yourRights.title: Your Rights (UK GDPR)
yourRights.intro: To exercise rights, email {{brand.supportEmail}}. You also have the right to complain to the ICO (Information Commissioner's Office) if you believe your rights are infringed.
items: Access ‚Äì request a copy of your personal data
Erasure ‚Äì ask us to delete (where no overriding basis applies)
Restriction ‚Äì limit processing under certain conditions
Objection ‚Äì to processing based on legitimate interests / direct marketing
Portability ‚Äì receive data you provided in a machine-readable format (where applicable)
Withdraw consent ‚Äì for any consent-based processing at any time

children.title: Children
children.content: We do not knowingly collect data from children under 13. If you believe a child has provided data, please contact us to remove it.

internationalTransfers.title: International Transfers
internationalTransfers.content: Where providers process data outside the UK, we rely on adequacy decisions or approved safeguards (e.g. standard contractual clauses). Current third-party processors include: web hosting & infrastructure provider (managed server host in UK/EU), email service (transactional & inbound), Plausible (EU-based analytics). Any future additions will be updated here.

updates.title: Updates to this Policy
updates.content: We may update this document. Material changes will be indicated by updating the "Effective Date". Continued use of the site constitutes acceptance.

testimonials.title: What Guests Say
testimonials.subtitle: Real diners on food, service, and matchday atmosphere

items.name: Tony B.
items.text: Superb Himali Lamb Curry; friendly staff helped us pick dishes. Great ales and plenty of sport on TV.

items.name: Colin S.
items.text: Fantastic night with friends ‚Äî attentive team, good food and drinks, brilliant atmosphere for groups.

items.name: C.V.
items.text: Old pub with a twist: excellent Nepalese curry, friendly service, and Sky Sports on ‚Äî just the thing.

items.name: Frances D.
items.text: Family-friendly pub; team handled dietary requests and the curries were lovely. Cozy, welcoming evening.

items.name: Josh P.
items.text: Second visit ‚Äî same delicious curry and great value for Cambridge. Friendly team keeps us coming back.

items.question: How do I book a table or cabin?
items.answer: Call +44 1223 921122, email {{brand.supportEmail}}, or use our Book a Table page. Book early for big matchdays or heated cabins.

items.question: Do you show live sports?
items.answer: Yes ‚Äî wall-to-wall HD screens indoors plus an outdoor projector for major fixtures. We‚Äôre a short walk from Abbey Stadium.

items.question: Do you offer takeaway or delivery?
items.answer: Yes. Call for collection, or order delivery via Uber Eats, Deliveroo, or Just Eat when available.

items.question: Is parking available?
items.answer: We have a small on-site car park (limited spaces). Additional paid parking is across the road at Cambridge Retail Park.

items.question: Are you family- and dog-friendly?
items.answer: Absolutely. High chairs available; kids‚Äô spice tweaks on request. Dogs are welcome in the bar and garden with water bowls provided.

items.question: Is the pub accessible?
items.answer: Yes. Wheelchair ramp access via the rear and an accessible WC on the ground floor. Ask staff if you need assistance.

items.question: Can you handle dietary requirements?
items.answer: Many Nepalese dishes are naturally gluten-free; vegetarian and vegan options are available. Tell us your allergies and we‚Äôll guide you.

items.question: When is the kitchen open?
items.answer: Mon‚ÄìFri 12:00‚Äì15:00 & 17:00‚Äì22:00, Sat 12:00‚Äì22:00, Sun 12:00‚Äì21:00. Bar stays open until 22:00 (23:00 Fri/Sat).

slides.alt: The Corner House pub exterior at dusk with warm lighting and welcoming atmosphere.
slides.eyebrow: Cambridge corner pub for HD sport, cosy snugs & Nepalese kitchens.
slides.headline: Welcome to {{brand.shortName}}
slides.copy: An independent Newmarket Road pub where HD matchdays meet Nepali-chef curries, pub classics, and a heated garden packed with private cabins.

slides.alt: Long rustic table layered with Nepalese sharing plates, salads, pickles, and drinks ready for a crowd inside the pub.
slides.eyebrow: Gather the crew around a table full of colour.
slides.headline: Feasts Made for Sharing
slides.copy: Mix momo, samosa, onion bhaji, crispy squid, and crunchy salads for the ultimate {{brand.nickname}} feast ‚Äî ideal for family-style dining or laid-back celebrations.

slides.alt: Warm wood bar with glass racks and a row of beer taps in a cosy pub interior.
slides.eyebrow: Cask ales, craft lagers & small-batch spirits.
slides.headline: Pouring Character
slides.copy: From perfectly kept pints to classic cocktails, our bar team knows their way around a pour. Pull up a stool and settle in.

slides.alt: Large pub garden with outdoor seating area and relaxed atmosphere.
slides.eyebrow: Big garden energy ‚Äì gather, relax, and watch the sky turn indigo.
slides.headline: Evenings Under the Lights
slides.copy: From golden hour to starlight, our garden is your go-to for after-work drinks, weekend catch-ups, and easy outdoor dining.

slides.alt: Bowl of mixed green salad with cherry tomatoes and cucumber on a white plate.
slides.eyebrow: Crunchy greens, bright flavours, made to order.
slides.headline: Fresh Starts
slides.copy: A simple, satisfying bowl‚Äîcrisp leaves, juicy tomatoes, cool cucumber and a zesty house dressing. Perfect on its own or alongside a pint.

slides.alt: Row of steamed dumplings with bright orange dipping sauce on a rectangular plate.
slides.eyebrow: Steamed, delicate, and dunked in our bold chilli sauce.
slides.headline: Hand-Pleated Momo
slides.copy: Comfort in one bite - soft wrappers, savoury filling, and a creamy kick on the side. A favourite for sharing or not.

slides.alt: Cosy dining area with warm lighting and comfortable seating.
slides.headline: Dine in Style
slides.copy: Whether it's a romantic dinner for two or a celebration with friends, our cosy dining areas provide the perfect backdrop.
